item.title: Git tracking and deleting remote branches
item.description: List the remote branches that exist for a repository you have cloned: git remote show origin Create a local branch that tracks one of the remote branches and then use that local branch: git checkout --track -b name_of_local_branch origin/name_of_remote_branch If you have not done a pull since someone else created the remote branch, you may first need to do: git fetch Remove branch from repo. git push {repo} :heads/{branch} Ex: git push origin :somebranch removes somebranch
